title.narrative: Greater Mekong Subregion Kunming-Hai Phong Transport Corridor-Noi Bai-Lao Cai Highway Project (Additional Financing)

description.narrative: The Noi Bai Lao Cai Highway Project constructs a 244-kilometer (km) grade-separated and access-controlled highway, including 10 interchanges with toll booths and five service areas, starting at Noi Bai in a suburb of Hanoi and ending at Lao Cai, on the border with the People's Republic of China (PRC) in northwest Viet Nam. Under the Project, four lanes for the Noi BaiYen Bai section and two lanes for the Yen BaiLao Cai section are constructed. Lands for additional two lanes are acquired for increasing traffic demands. Also, the Project includes (i) electric, communications, and tolling systems and associated facilities, and the Vietnam Expressway Corporation's (VEC's) highway operation and maintenance (O&M) equipment and vehicles; (ii) capacity building for VEC on project implementation, corporate financial management, highway O&M, and safeguard planning and implementation; and (iii) HIV/AIDS, human and illicit drugs trafficking awareness and prevention program.
